pr_title: Add JUnit 5 Extension to Capture Runtime Metrics

timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Debatable, but yeah maybe. I thought since what we're running is so quick, I should just try to let if finish the current one. So I may get the very last value, or not, but either way it isn't a big deal.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Should you give the extension a more explicit name, since it's about performance metrics?
timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Yeah, just named it when I was trying to get something working. Will rename.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: If it can be private I'll switch it to private.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Hm what's the difference with @BeforeAll in Performance?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: BeforeAll doesn't run before all tests. The BeforeAll runs before every test class, not the whole test suite. This one only ever runs once before everything else.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92
ShirleyZheng92
